mdRecord.dcterms:title: Saint Francis Xavier Church, exterior
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Keely, Patrick Charles (American architect, 1816-1896) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: In May 1878, with 5,000 people in attendance, the cornerstone was laid for the current magnificent church designed by the famous architect, Patrick C. Keely. Built over the next four years, the current church has been in use since 1882. The exterior of the church is Neo-baroque in style, while the interior has stained-glass windows with a pre-Raphaelite character. http://www.sfxavier.org/wordpress/restoration-history/a-brief-history/ http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/St._Francis_Xavier_Church_%28Manhattan%29 [work]
